tn.text: "day number seven" or "Saturday" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: Whoever does any work on that day must be put to death
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "You must kill anyone who does work on that day" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Moses tells the Israelites to make the things Yahweh commanded him in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:25:03|25:3-7]].
"Take up a collection for Yahweh"

tn.ref: all of you who have a willing heart
tn.text: Here "heart" refers to the person bringing the offering. AT: "everyone who is willing" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Moses continues telling the people what God commanded them to do.
"Every man with a skill"
The clasps fit into the loops to hold the curtains together. See how you translated these in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:26:04|26:4-6]].
These are heavy objects that rest on the ground and keep the object attached to them from moving. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:25:31|25:31]].
This is the lid that sits on top of the ark where the atonement offering was made. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:25:15|25:17]].
"The people of Israel brought"
This bread represented the presence of God. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:25:28|25:30]].
This is a frame of crossed bronze bars for holding wood when burning. See how you translated "grate" in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:27:03|27:4]].
These were large curtains made of cloth. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:26:36|26:36]].
These were strong pieces of wood set upright and used as supports. See how you translated these in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:27:09|27:10]].
These were blocks that had a slot in them to keep the board in place. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:26:19|26:19]].
sharp pieces of wood or metal used to secure the corners of a tent to the ground.  See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:27:17|27:19]].
woven garments** - This was clothing made from narrow linen threads that someone twisted together to make a stronger thread. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:28:06|28:8]].
This refers to the people in the tribes. AT: "the people from all the tribes of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

Here "heart" refers to the person. The heart that responded to God is spoken of as if it were water stirred up by a storm.  AT: "who responded to God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Here "spirit" refers to the person. AT: "who was willing" or "who wanted to"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: all who had a willing heart
tn.text: Here "heart" refers to the person. AT: "everyone who was willing" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
These are different kinds of jewelry.
For 35:23 see how you translated many of these words in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:25:03|25:4-5]].

Possible meanings are 1) "material that is dyed blue, purple, and scarlet," probably wool yarn, or 2) "blue, purple and scarlet dye" to dye the linen. See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:25:03|25:4]].

Here "hearts" refers to the women. The hearts of the women who responded to God are spoken of as if they were water stirred up by a storm.  AT: "who responded to God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: The leaders brought ... Moses to be made
tn.text: For 35:27-29 see how you translated many of these words in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:25:01|25:1-2]] and [[:en:bible:notes:exo:25:03|25:3-7]].
Here "heart" refers to the people. AT: "who was willing" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: He has filled Bezalel with his Spirit
tn.text: God's Spirit who gave Bezalel the ability to work is spoken of here as if he was something that filled up Bezalel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
For 35:30-33 see how you translated these words in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:31:01|31:1-2]] and [[:en:bible:notes:exo:31:03|31:3-5]].
Moses continues speaking to the people.

tn.ref: He has put it in his heart to teach
tn.text: Here "heart" refers to Bezalel. The ability to teach is spoken of as if it something that could be placed in a heart.  AT: "He gave Bezalel the ability to teach" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Skill to create beautiful objects is spoken of as if it was something that could fill up a person. AT: "made them very skillful" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: Oholiab son of Ahisamach, from the tribe of Dan
tn.text: "Oholiab" and "Ahisamach" are names of men. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:31:06|31:6]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
a person who cuts designs into a hard material such as wood, stone, or metal
a person who sews designs into cloth
people who are skilled in making beautiful objects by hand
a person who creates cloth using thread
a person who creates beauty with materials
